titleStmt.title: Letter of Theodorus to the Phylacitae
titleStmt.author: Theodorus

msContents.summary: Letter from Theodorus to the Phylacitae, concerning the survey and disposition of land. (Grenfell & Hunt)

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 10 lines written with the fibers. All margins are visible. Text mentions the location of Talae.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 10.3 x 10.5cm. The bottom right corner shows a red cartonnage in a diamond pattern and is slightly whiter than the rest of the papyrus. Other small pieces along the bottom show evidence of the same pattern. The upper right corner is missing and much of the bottom has crumbled away. The writing has faded considerably. And the papyrus itself shows water damage.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1902) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1907/9?, Dr. Parrish Collection).

div.ab: Theodorus to the guards at Talae, greeting. Petosiris the toparch and Petimouthes the topogrammateus have written to me that they have sold to Philammon out of the holding of Philoxenus at Talae 3 2/3 arourae of grass-aracus land. Take the komogrammateus therefore with you, and measure the area to him, but do not part with any more, knowing that you will be held responsible. Good-bye. The 15th year, Tubi 2. (Grenfell & Hunt)
